content.raw:
Right, and the problem is not only during compilation time, but also in runtime, since newer gcc versions require newer libstdc++ version. So an user with a Precise system will see the following message when trying to install gcc-4.8 compiled packages:

```
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 foo0 : Depends: libstdc++6 (>= 4.8.1) but 4.6.3-1ubuntu5 is to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
```

Which kind of breaks our support for the Precise distribution.
